content: Hello! How can I help you today?
I can't stop worrying about my upcoming presentation at work
I understand that feeling anxious about presentations can be really tough. Could you tell me more about what specifically worries you about the presentation?
I keep thinking I'll mess up and everyone will think I'm incompetent
That sounds difficult to deal with. When you imagine messing up, what specific scenarios come to mind? And what makes you think others would judge you as incompetent?
I just know I'll forget what to say or someone will ask a question I can't answer, then everyone will realize I don't deserve my position

I hear you're really concerned about potentially forgetting your material or not being able to answer questions. That can certainly feel stressful. What evidence do you have that one mistake would make everyone think you don't deserve your position? Have you seen this happen to others at your workplace?
No, but I just feel like I always need to be perfect or people will see through me. I can't sleep thinking about it.

It sounds like you're putting a lot of pressure on yourself to be perfect, and that's affecting your well-being, even making it hard to sleep. I'm curious - would you judge a colleague as harshly as you're judging yourself if they made a small mistake during a presentation?
I guess not. But I still can't shake this feeling. Can you help me deal with this anxiety?
